exceptions.exn: In environment n : nat i : bsm_instr n s, t1, t2 : bsm_state n H1 : i // s -1> t1 H2 : i // s -1> t2 The term "n" has type "nat" while it is expected to have type "bsm_instr ?n".

In environment H : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), sss_step one_step P s t1 -> sss_step one_step P s t2 -> t1 = t2 n : nat i : bsm_instr n s, t1, t2 : bsm_state n H1 : i // s -1> t1 H2 : i // s -1> t2 Unable to unify "i // s -1> t1" with "t1 = t2".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
i: bsm_instr n
t2: bsm_state n
t1: bsm_state n
s: bsm_state n

Goal:
i // s -1> t1 -> i // s -1> t2 -> t1 = t2

Premises:
bsm_state = fun n : nat => (nat * vec (list bool) n)%type : nat -> Set Arguments bsm_state _%nat_scope
Inductive bsm_instr (n : nat) : Set := bsm_pop : pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n | bsm_push : pos n -> bool -> bsm_instr n Arguments bsm_instr _%nat_scope Arguments bsm_pop [n]%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bsm_push [n]%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope
sss_step_fun : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), sss_step one_step P s t1 -> sss_step one_step P s t2 -> t1 = t2
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p + ?m) -> pos (p + ?n) where ?m : [n : nat i : bsm_instr n s : bsm_state n t1 : bsm_state n t2 : bsm_state n |- nat] ?n : [n : nat i : bsm_instr n s : bsm_state n t1 : bsm_state n t2 : bsm_state n |- nat]
sss_steps_stall_fun : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (p q : nat) (s1 s2 : nat * data), sss_step_stall one_step P s2 -> sss_steps one_step P p s1 s2 -> sss_steps one_step P q s1 s2 -> p = q
ZifyClasses.impl_morph : forall s1 s2 t1 t2 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> s2 < -> t2 -> (s1 -> s2) < -> (t1 -> t2)
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
String.string_ind : forall P : String.string -> Prop, P String.EmptyString -> (forall (a : Ascii.ascii) (s : String.string), P s -> P (String.String a s)) -> forall s : String.string, P s
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
pos2nat_nat2pos : forall (n i : nat) (H : i < n), pos2nat (nat2pos H) = i
String.substring = fix substring (n m : nat) (s : String.string) {struct s} : String.string := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => String.EmptyString | S m' => match s with | String.EmptyString => s | String.String c s' => String.String c (substring 0 m' s') end end | S n' => match s with | String.EmptyString => s | String.String _ s' => substring n' m s' end end : nat -> nat -> String.string -> String.string Arguments String.substring (_ _)%nat_scope _%string_scope
out_code = fun (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : code X) => i < code_start P \/ code_end P <= i : forall X : Type, nat -> code X -> Prop Arguments out_code {X}%type_scope _%nat_scope _ /
String.length = fix length (s : String.string) : nat := match s with | String.EmptyString => 0 | String.String _ s' => S (length s') end : String.string -> nat Arguments String.length _%string_scope
BSM_HALTING = fun P : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (i, s0) := s in let (P0, v) := s0 in sss_terminates (bsm_sss (n:=n)) (i, P0) (i, v) : BSM_PROBLEM -> Prop
in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)
bsm_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
bsm_sss_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> SProp), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
in_bsm_sss_pop_0 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])
in_bsm_sss_pop_1 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])
POP : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n
PUSH : forall n : nat, pos n -> bool -> bsm_instr n
bsm_instr_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Set), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_rect : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Type), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Prop), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> SProp), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
Inductive bsm_sss (n : nat) : bsm_instr n ->...-> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x]) | in_bsm_sss_push : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x]) Arguments bsm_sss [n]%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_E [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_0 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_1 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_push [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope
in_bsm_sss_push : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x])
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
Pnat.Nat2Pos.inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> BinPos.Pos.of_nat n = BinPos.Pos.of_nat m -> n = m
Nat.eq_mul_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0

```coq
intros H1 H2.
apply sss_step_fun with (one_step := bsm_sss n).
intro i.
intro s.
intro t1.
intro t2.
intros.
apply H1.
Qed.

original: intros H1 H2. apply sss_step_fun with (one_step := bsm_sss n). intro i. intro s. intro t1. intro t2. intros. apply H1.
